result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Cathey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

AODA evaluation and followthrough.
Absolute sobriety.
No Class B establishments.
No contact with victim Shawn S.
Hand written letter of apology to victim through Agent.
Any other counseling recommended.
Submit DNA sample at Sheriff's Dept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J Cathey

Prior: W4220 Cth E, Bonduel, WI 54107

Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  DA indicates 2 sentencing options (1 straight jail, 2 probation)  Defendant wants probation option.  Court withholds sentence, 1 year probation with conditions.

Absolute sobriety.
No Class B establishments.
No contact with S.S.
Pictures & prints.

Defendant Robert J Cathey in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doesn't qualify for PD, Court will not appoint counsel.  DA makes recommendation for either probation or straight jail time.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
